title: I'm convinced my reports go into the trash can
body:
I play in Bronze, so there are many reports. Never have i had any feedback from RIOT
Do you even care about Bronze RIOT?

my wallet is closed

replies.body:
http://65.media.tumblr.com/640f77f7c193eabba1ada71153211ee3/tumblr_inline_n4iv6t4Zx61qj0upm.gif
Objection!
I have got a number of report popup in my client lobby saying something along the line of "Thank you for your report, we have punished the player". Ergo, your argument is invalid!

Anyway, on a serious note, that report popup proves that they indeed follow up everyone's report.
It might be possible they have their own admin-only Tribunal system.
So do not lose heart, keep reporting those outlaws.

The issue lies in the severe limitations of that notification. Only the last games worth of reports that have triggered a punishment will receive a notification, so for the vast majority of players you report you won't see that little popup. I myself got my first one a few months ago, and haven't seen one since.

You only need to take a quick look in PB and H and S to see that people get banned though. Plenty of terrible logs in there if you go down that rabbit hole.
what is PB and H and S?

PB = Player Behaviour
H and S = Help and Support
They're sub-sections of the boards, generally where people post about getting banned.

> I'm convinced my reports go into the trash can

Well, they would if you continually submit false reports. False reports will gradually invalidate any future reports you make to the point where they're simply ignored.

As long as you make sure there is viable reason for each report you submit, there should never be a problem.

Also, it's important to note that the instant feedback system currently only informs the most recent player to report an individual who is punished.

so just because i am Bronze and there is a feeder/troll/DC/toxic player every second game my reports are ignored?

Ya I still think  RIOT doesnt care about Bronze

Spending my money elsewhere. Thx for free game RIOT

It's not the volume of reports that will reduce your report weight, but rather the accuracy. If you were say, reporting people who had a really bad game (which happens a lot on Bronze) but weren't intentionally feeding all the time, your report weight would go down since you are submitting invalid reports frequently.

I guess i should stop reporting to get a better report weight.....

what determines the difference between a guy who runs down mid, and a guy who just stands there when attacked? Both are feeding imo. Do RIOT watch the replay's to see their actions?

> I guess i should stop reporting to get a better report weight.....

You don't have to stop reporting, just avoid reporting out of spite, hate, retaliation etc.

> Do RIOT watch the replays to see their actions?

Don't really need to watch the replays. A good look at various statistics, such as K/D/A, Kill Participation, Champion Role, Position, Item build, CS, Objective Control etc. is (mostly) all that's needed to figure out if someone is intentionally feeding or not.
